title: Family Reunion T-Shirts in a Table
question_text:
Eileen is in charge of ordering t-shirts for the Brown family reunion. The table below shows how many of each size adult t-shirts she will need and how many of each size child t-shirts she will need for those who are attending the reunion.
SmallMediumLargeExtra Large
Adult$10$$21$$18$$5$
Child$12$$9$$14$$0$
Based on the data, which of the following statements CANNOT be justified?

choices.text: More adult-sized t-shirts are needed for the family reunion than child-sized t-shirts.
The t-shirt order will contain a lower percentage of small adult-sized t-shirts than small child-sized t-shirts.
A child-sized t-shirt is more likely to be size large (not extra large) than is an adult-sized t-shirt.
The relative frequency of adult-sized large t-shirts in the order is smaller than the relative frequency of child-sized large t-shirts in the order.

The proportion of small-sized t-shirts in the order is approximately
0.247
.
